body.directions: Play each audio of vocabulary phrases in Chinese. Then, select the correct answer.

body.quiz: Which of the following is a good response to the audio question?
body.answer: 我姓 Smith. Wǒ xìng Smith.
body.correct: You got it! We can use the verb 姓 xìng to ask people for their last names.
body.incorrect: Oops… please pay attention to the second syllable “xìng.”

body.quiz: What information should you give, following the audio phrase?
body.correct: Nice job! The verb 叫 jiào is used to ask people for their names.
body.incorrect: Oops…please pay attention to the second syllable “jiào.”

body.quiz: How would you respond to the audio sentence?
body.correct: You are right! The phrase “很高兴认识你。Hěn gāoxìng rènshi nǐ.” means “Very nice to meet you.” A nice response to it would be “Same here.”
body.incorrect: Please try again. You may want to break down the sentence into individual words in order to understand it.

body.correct: Excellent job! The phrase “我也是。 Wǒ yě shì.” means “Likewise./I also am.” You can use this phrase any time you wish to express agreement.
body.incorrect: So close… please listen to the audio again.

body.quiz: In what situation would you say the audio sentence?
body.answer: When you are introduced to a new classmate
options: When you run into an old friend
Talking to your mom before going to bed
body.correct: You nailed it! Meeting a new classmate is a perfect occasion to ask for his or her name.
body.incorrect: Not quite… please listen to the audio again. You may want to break down the sentence into individual words in order to understand it.

body.quiz: What would be the question that prompts the audio as a response?
body.correct: Excellent job! We can use the verb 姓 xìng in a sentence to introduce our last names.
body.incorrect: Very close… please pay attention to the second syllable “xìng.”
